intro: Pityrocarpa schumanniana, commonly known as the Schumann's ironwood, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Burseraceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood and thick, waxy leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers that are followed by spherical, red or orange fruits. It thrives in dry, well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and hardiness, it is cultivated in arid and semi-arid landscapes around the world.
